comments:
XML data types that are numeric and contain empty values will cause an "ANY" type error.

The problem occurs in 2.2 release, and 2.2.1 July 9, 2007 build.

The problem was fixed in one of the 2.2 milestones, but has resurfaced.

1.  In the 'Edit Data Set' dialog, the Column Mapping section, an error occurs when trying to preview mapping results.

2.  In the 'Edit Data Set' dialog, the Preview Results section works correctly.

Created an attachment (id=73463)
Report causing the error to occur

Change FILELIST to point to TxnListByDateQueryRs.xml

1. This will be fixed pretty soon, thanks
3. The expression "if(row["Date"]!=null)row["Date"].toUpperCase()" seems odd

(In reply to comment #5)
> 1. This will be fixed pretty soon, thanks
> 3. The expression "if(row["Date"]!=null)row["Date"].toUpperCase()" seems odd

Yes, the expression "if(row["Date"]!=null)row["Date"].toUpperCase()" is odd, but ok.  The code is auto-generated from a tool.  For sorting, anything not numeric is uppercased.  Due to character sorting behavior, the text needs to be uppercased prior to sorting.

I actually consider the BIRT case comparison a bug.  The String class has had the compareToIgnoreCase since 1.2.  (almost 10 years).  

The problem is age old.  We dealt with the case comparison issue in C applications in the 80?s.  Microsoft induced a bug in their Windows SDK that has stayed with us ever since.
What I meant was expr. row["Date"] returns a Date type which can't be uppercased unless it's been converted to String first
I think you are correct.  I assume it can read row["Date"].toString(), which should always return a string for any data type.

FYI:

I think I am seeing a related problem around Decimal conversion.

In the Data Sets -> Edit Data Set -> Column Mapping -> Table Preview

I get the following error if one of the Decimal entries is empty (null).

There is no problem when parsing XML data types that are numeric and contain empty values, otherwise you won't be getting the correct results from PreviewResultsPage either.

The exception occurs when parsing the maxRow, which has now been handled by adding fault tolerance. Please give it a try tomorrow when codes are available in the build. Thanks for reporting.
*** Bug 196573 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

traces.message: An error happen during population of data. This might be caused by including data of mixed type in a column of "ANY" type.
